definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: And a developing country may become stalled at the brain drain stage.
sentences.chinese: 在人才外流阶段发展中国家的发展可能会陷入停滞。

sentences.english: They find it difficult to keep good staff because of the brain drain.
sentences.chinese: 由于人才外流，他们很难保住一班齐备的人马了。

sentences.english: Why is migration a problem for global health?
sentences.chinese: 为什么人才外流会影响全球卫生？

sentences.english: The “brain drain” may also undermine medical training in future.
sentences.chinese: “人才外流”还可能破坏未来的医疗培训。

sentences.english: This “brain drain” has long bothered policymakers in poor countries.
sentences.chinese: 这种“人才外流”在贫穷的国家长久的困扰执政者们。

definition: to flow back/reflux/circumfluence/refluence/backward flow/returning flow (e.g. of talent)
"magnetic" force that attracts investment and talented individuals/in particular, the attraction China has for people and capital from around the world
more hands than needed (idiom); too many cooks spoil the broth
to be at a standstill/to mark time
more critical with every passing day
